reporting-org.narrative: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

title.narrative: Accelerating the development of Health Policy and Systems Research (HPSR) capacity in the Western Pacific Region (WPR) for health system strengthening

description.narrative:
Our project aims to:
a) Design and field-test an HPSR training programme in Malaysia. An initial needs assessment will help tailor this to diverse audiences. Internationally agreed HPSR competencies will be adapted to the country context, creating a package that is supported by key actors and can be scaled up nationally. An innovative theory of change will be applied to track training outcomes and processes, documenting what works, where, and when.
b) Undertake HPSR capacity mapping in Malaysia and selected WPR countries where there is demand, to identify capacity gaps, national priorities and opportunities to align HPSR training with national health policies (e.g. the Philippines).
c) Learn from the Malaysian experience to develop locally-led, country-specific plans and strategies for scaling up HPSR capacity in these WPR countries.
d) Develop proposals for HPSR projects that address important health system or health service needs in Malaysia and elsewhere in WPR and seek national/regional endorsement and funding.
e) Document and disseminate Malaysian and WPR country experiences through Health Systems Global (HSG), providing a roadmap to accelerate the expansion of HPSR capacity in other low and middle-income countries.

This project will accelerate the expansion of HPSR capacity in Malaysia, and in WPR, to support health system strengthening. Working in close collaboration with national stakeholders in Malaysia, we will develop and pilot a training programme that can be implemented at scale. This experience in Malaysia will be used to inform the development of plans for HPSR capacity building in a range of other WPR countries.

participating-org.narrative: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine
